items.title: Bandhan Bank Q3 loans and advances surge 15% YoY, deposits up 20%
items.description: Bandhan Bank's total deposits grew 20.1% YoY to Rs 140,999 crore, but saw a slight QoQ decline of 1.1%. CASA deposits rose 5.5% YoY to Rs 44,735 crore but fell 5.4% QoQ. The CASA ratio is now 31.7%, down from 36.1% a year ago.

items.title: Adani Wilmar Q3 Update: Revenue jumps 33% YoY aided by volume growth
items.description: The edible oils segment of Adani Wilmar saw consumer downtrading, but the company retained its market share through a diverse brand portfolio across price points. In the foods category, key packaged products like wheat flour, rice, nuggets, pulses, poha, and sugar achieved strong double-digit growth, according to the update.

items.title: Bajaj Finance Q3 update: New loans jump 22%YoY to 12.06 million, AUM surges 28%
items.description: In Q3 FY25, Bajaj Finance’s AUM grew by Rs 24,100 crore, driven by strong demand across lending segments. New loans booked during the quarter hit a record 12.06 million, marking a 22% YoY increase from 9.86 million in the same period last year, showcasing robust growth momentum.

items.title: Vedanta Q3 Update: Aluminium production jumps 3% YoY to 614 kt, Zinc India down 2%
items.description: Vedanta posted a Rs 5,603 crore profit in Q2 FY24, rebounding from a Rs 915 crore loss last year, despite a 4% YoY decline in revenue to Rs 37,171 crore, reflecting improved operational performance and recovery.

items.title: Bank of Baroda Q3 update: Global business jumps 12% YoY to Rs 25.64 lakh crore
items.description: Bank of Baroda’s global advances grew 11.65% YoY to Rs 11.72 lakh crore in Q3FY25, up from Rs 10.49 lakh crore in Q3FY24. Meanwhile, global deposits rose 11.82% YoY to Rs 13.92 lakh crore, compared to Rs 12.45 lakh crore in the same quarter last year, showcasing consistent growth in the bank’s core metrics.

items.title: IDFC First Bank Q3 Update: Lender reports 25% YoY growth in total business to Rs 4,58,213 crore
items.description: IDFC First Bank's CASA deposits rose 32.3% YoY to Rs 1,13,091 crore as of December 2024. The CASA ratio improved to 47.8% from 46.8% a year ago but was slightly lower than the 48.9% recorded in September 2024, reflecting consistent growth in its deposit base despite minor fluctuations.

items.title: DMart Q3 Update: Standalone revenue jumps 17% to Rs 15,565 crore
items.description: Avenue Supermarts, which operates retail chain DMart on Thursday reported a 17% year-on-year jump in its standalone revenue for the quarter ended December 31, 2024 at Rs 15,565.23 crore. The company had reported a topline of Rs 13,247.33 crore in the year ago period.
